item.title: Laurie add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Art is the lie that enables us to realize the truth." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Laurie add a quote by William Shakespear
item.description: "There is nothing either good or bad, but thinking makes it so." -- William Shakespear

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I have no doubt that it is part of the destiny of the human race in it's gradual improvement, to leave off eating animals." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "It is dangerous to be right in matters on which the established authorities are wrong." -- Voltaire

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Edna St. Vincent Millay
item.description: "pity me that the heart is slow to learn what the swift mind beholds at every turn." -- Edna St. Vincent Millay

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Nothing is at last sacred but the integrity of your own mind." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Once I had a rose named after me and I was very flattered. But I was not pleased to read the description in the catalogue: "No good in a bed, but fine up against a wall." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "You believe in a book that has talking animals, wizards, witches, demons, sticks turning into snakes, burning bushes, food falling from the sky, people walking on water, and all sorts of magical, absurd and primitive stories, and you say that we are the ones that need help?" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "There are two ways to dislike poetry: One is to dislike it; the other is to read Pope." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Work is the curse of the drinking classes." -- Oscar Wilde
